section.title: Introduction
section.para: This article describes how to deploy the &alp; (&alpshort;) raw disk image.

section.title: Hardware requirements
section.para: The minimum supported hardware requirements for deploying &alpshort; follow:

listitem.para: The maximum number of CPUs supported by software design is 8192.
&alpshort; requires at least 1GB RAM. Bear in mind that this is a minimal value for the operation system, the actual memory size depends on the workload.
The minimum hard disk space is 12GB, while the recommended value is 20GB of hard disk space. Adjust the value according to workloads of your containers.

section.title: Deploying &alpshort; on a &kvm; &vmhost;
section.para: This procedure describes steps to deploy &alpshort; as a &kvm; virtual machine using the &vmm;.

step.para: Download &alpshort; virtual machine image on the host where you will run &alpshort;. Go to &alp-dld-site;, and download the latest disk image of &alpshort;. For example:
Start &vmm;, select FileNew VM and Import existing disk image. Confirm with Forward.
Specify the path to the &alpshort; disk image that you previously downloaded and the type of linux OS you are deploying, for example Generic Linux 2020. Confirm with Forward.
Specify the amount of memory and number of processor that you want to dedicate the &alpshort; virtual machine and confirm with Forward.
Specify the name for the virtual machine and the network to be used.

If you want to deploy &alpshort; with only a minimal setup options, confirm with Finish. The &alpshort; disk image will be booted and &jeosfirstboot; will take care of the deployment. Refer to for next steps.
If you want to specify detailed deployment options, you need to use &ignition; or &combustion; tools to supply your setup during the disk image boot process. For more details, refer to and .

section.title: Deploying &alpshort; with &jeosfirstboot;
section.para: When booting the &alpshort; raw image for the first time, &jeosfirstboot; enables you to perform minimal configuration of your system:

step.para: After booting the &alpshort; disk image, you will be presented with a bootloader screen. Select &alpshort; and confirm with .
&jeosfirstboot; displays a welcome screen. Confirm with .
On the next screens, select keyboard, confirm the license agreement, and select the time zone.
In the Enter root password dialog window, enter a password for the &rootuser; and confirm it.
&alpshort; is successfully deployed using a minimal initial configuration.

section.title: Summary
section.para: After the deployment of &alpshort; is finished, you are presented with the login prompt. Log in as &rootuser; and you are ready to setup the system and install additional workloads.
